page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The building of{St Magnus Cathedral began in 1137,by Earl Rognvald 1 who was Earl Magnus's nephew.He built the cathedral in memory of his uncle Magnus.It is built of{red and yellow sandstone, carved by master masons from Durham.It took nearly three hundred years to complete during which time the design changed greatly from the original plan.It is owned by the people of Orkney, which makes it unique.{Tankerness House}was built opposite St Magnus and housed the clergy and choir boys in the 12th _ 13th C. It is now a Town Museum. {The Bishop's Palace}was built for the} bishop of the Cathedral to live in. Later in history Earl Stewart let his musketeers live in it.It is now in ruins and looked after by the Department of the Environment.
